content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-328-05-A
|Item_parent=Non-drug therapies and medical devices
|Item_parent_short=Non-drug therapies and medical devices
|Rank=A
|Heading=General knowledge of orthoses
|Description=Different types and indications
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Bisseriex Hélène,De Boissezon Xavier
|Order=5}}

'''Orthosis''': a device that supplements a limb or segment of limb that is deficient or the spine.

It can be small or large equipment.


'''Objectives of orthotic treatment''' ''(different from orthopaedic treatment after trauma or surgery)'''

- downtime

- rest

- stabilisation

- correction

- substitution

option_a.title: A device that supplements a limb or segment of limb that is deficient or the spine.
option_a.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option

option_b.title: A type of surgery.
option_b.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option

option_c.title: A device that is used to correct a deformity.
option_c.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option

option_d.title: A type of orthotic treatment.
option_d.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
